intro: Leptodactylon californicum, commonly known as the California groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads made up of many small florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Leptodactylon californicum is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
